page.title: 17ST.MARTINS PIT MOUNT
page.content:
In{1968 Ifton Colliery}in{St.Martins was closed down by the coal board because of a fault in the mine.{Three shale tips were left and in{1975}the council{reclaimed}the land.They planted{grass}and{trees}such as oak,beech,maple and elm.They also put in a{waterfall}as part of the drainage and marked{public footpaths.}The area was opened to the public in{1978}and to remember that, there is a plaque at the bottom of one mount,and at the bottom of another one there is an old coal truck mounted on a block.
When you stand at the top of the{pit {mount}you have a really nice{view.}You can see Lord Trevor's House, Chirk, {Stan's Shop, St.Martins Parish Church, {Ifton Heath}and some of{Rhyn Park {School.
